result.execSummary:
The defendant Susan J Kordosky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross. (Bond applied - balance due)

No contact with JR Liquors and Best Buy-Plover or Amit Zala.
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
Dismissed and Read In is 15PT1332.

supervisions.notes: Financial obligations are paid in full.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Susan J Kordosky

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Susan J Kordosky in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Defendant Susan J Kordosky in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:00 a.m.  Court calls the case and states appearances.
Parties have received and reviewed revocation packet.
ADA Constable makes recommendations for sentencing.
Atty. Schmidt concurs with recommendation. All court obligations have been paid.
Ms. Kordosky makes statements to the court.
State has complied with Victim Rights Notification.

BY THE COURT: ****TIME SERVED****
75 days Jail, with 75 days credit results in time served sentence.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.

11:47 a.m. Defendant Susan J Kordosky in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. W/H Sent. Probation 12 mo. with conditions. No restitution requested.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. DRI 15PT1332

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt concurs.  

BY THE COURT:***Probation
W/H Sentence: 12 mo Probation
Conditions:
Pay Costs + DNA Surcharge
No contact with JR Liquors and Best Buy-Plover or Amit Zala.
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
DRI 15PT1332

Cash previously posted. 
No contact with Amit Zala, JR Liquor or Jennifer Carrick.

Defendant Susan J Kordosky in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

Court notes a $200 cash bond has been posted. 
State recommends the cash bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
